content: all sizes insert t-marker foot varies per individual in my case 6 4 insert i-marker heel bottom 1 75 insert md-marker heel top 3 insert d-marker leg 6 25 note final leg height above the heel will be 4 5 if you prefer taller simply cast on more stitches expect the final height to be about 72% of the distance for which you cast on * distances all incorporate 13% negative ease once you obtain the measurements for your cast on figure out what your gauge is then multiply the number for each segment by the number of sts per inch if you do the math for 8 sts per inch you ll see that it matches up with the cast on diagram in the knitty article width you will also need to know how wide to make your fabric so that it will fit you or the intended recipient here s the width table from the knitty pattern based on this you can find your target width heel diagonal no of fits foot circumference finished foot circ finished fabric width in in inches row in inches in inches grafted 1 inches before graft 2 narrow 11 5 12 34 8 8 5 7 25 6 med 12 12 5 36 8 5 9 7 75 6 5 wide 12 5 13 38 9 9 5 8 6 75 x-wide 13 13 5 40 9 5 10 8 5 7 1 width incorporates negative ease working to your own gauge in order to work wraptor free of the constraints of matching my row gauge stage 1 work instructions as written in the knitty pattern until your fabric is 1/3 your total target width this may or may not correspond to 12 row which is what the pattern describes if it s not 12 row you ll have to disregard the stitch counts from here out because yours won t match stage 2 work as written until your fabric is 2/3 your total target width again your stitch counts may not match those listed but the line-by-line instructions will still apply stage 3 work as written until your fabric reaches your total target width stage 3 should be the same number of row that you worked in stage 1 stage 4 this stage requires some re-jiggering 1 instead of placing 2 s-markers a specific number of stitches above and below the d-marker you ll place one s-marker 5inches below your d-marker you won t need an s-marker2 2 starting at the s-marker work a series of short row 4 inches long with each row move the row closer to the cuff by 2 stitches continue until your instep patch is 1 1/2 inches high 3 work to cuff then work a series of short row to about 1/2 inch high 4 work back down to the origin of your short row concealing all wraps as you go
